name: Novotel Leeds Centre

reviews.text: This is my third weekend trip to Leeds and this is by far the best hotel that I have stayed in. Much, much better than the Crowne Plaza. The bedroom was pleasant and of a good size and the bathroom was modern (a major fault at the Crowne Plaza). It was excellent value for money through Lateroom.com and the price included breakfast. The breakfast was very good when compared to other hot buffets. Once again, much better in our opinion than the Crowne Plaza.
reviews.title: Best in Leeds for me

reviews.text: The staff were exceptional. The receptionist gave our young son a complimentary teddy which absolutely thrilled him. The hotel is really well situated (closer to the centre than Bewleys) and we struggled to find any faults at all. This will be our first choice next time we visit Leeds. Oh yes, just thought of a fault - no free WIFI - in this day and age!!!!
reviews.title: Just Right!

reviews.text: Having stayed at this hotel in the past I knew what to expect and I wasn't dissapointed. The room was of the usual Novotel standard, basic but comfortable, as well as being clean and tidy. The staff were very helpful at all times and keen to help when required. There is an underground car park and the hotel is 5 minutes walk from the station and City Centre. Close by is an excellent Indian resturant called the Nawaab. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent, being a French hotel chain you can be sure that the continental offfering will be a good standard and better than the 'English' hotel versions. I was particularly impressed with the business facilities which were excellent and the person in charge was, attentive, friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: What we needed - no more, no less

reviews.text: 2 girlfriends and I booked a weekend away through Superbreak, including train travel to Leeds and 2 nights at the Novotel. The hotel was fine for what we wanted - something clean, near the train station, comfortable.
reviews.title: Very friendly and efficient. Excellent service

reviews.text: The rooms were suitably appointed with a double bed and a sofa bed while the bathroom had shampoo, bodywash etc as you would expect from a hotel of this calibre. All staff that we encountered were friendly, and breakfast was solid, without being extraordinary.
reviews.title: excellent hotel with lovely friendly staff

reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife while visiting our daughter at Leeds Uni. The hotel was clean and tidy and the staff were helpful. Our room was on an upper floorly and was exactly as expected from a modern city centre hotel. We had breakfast included and this was fine.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Lively Leeds

reviews.text: Leeds seems to be the night life hotspot of the North. On arrival at the hotel there were 'hen' groups checking in for a nights stay and our hearts sank. We had not come for a sleepless night BUT our fears were premature as we had no disturbance at all and slept well. It appears the hotel management are well practised at coping with weekend hen and stag groups but this hotel may not suit everyone.
reviews.title: stayed better places

reviews.text: i stayed here once or twice for business. i now stay at the bewleys in leeds as it is better food and parking. the first time i stayed here i had a room that had a random knocking nosie coming from elsewhere in the hotel and fair enough i got moved the next morning. food is good but restaurant lacks sole. the car parking is a nightmare and very few spaces available thats one of the main reasons i stay at the bewleys now. internet was a rip off so did not bother with that.
reviews.title: The Ideal hotel in Leeds

description: AA 4 star Novotel Leeds Centre is located in the centre of Leeds suiting business travellers with eight meeting rooms for up to 80 people and WiFi internet. An equally attractive base for a short break or holiday, the hotel is close to shops, nightlife and the Leeds first Direct Arena. Novotel Leeds Centre offers Elements restaurant, bar, fitness suite, sauna, steam room and limited indoor pay parking on site. The main railway station is a few minutes walk away, Leeds Bradford Airport is approximately 15 km drive.
